input_data.title: Will & Grace
input_data.overview: Will Truman and Grace Adler are best friends living in New York, and when Grace's engagement falls apart, she moves in with Will. Together, along with their friends, they go through the trials of dating, sex, relationships and their careers, butting heads at times but ultimately supporting one another while exchanging plenty of witty banter along the way.

response.analytical_summary: Will & Grace is a sitcom centered on the close friendship between a gay lawyer and his female best friend, navigating the complexities of love, career, and life in New York City. The series blends observational humor with broader comedic set pieces, exploring themes of identity, acceptance, and the evolving nature of relationships. Known for its sharp wit and ensemble cast, the show offers a lighthearted and often irreverent portrayal of modern urban life, emphasizing the importance of chosen family and unwavering support.
response.spoiler_rich_plot_summary: The series begins with Grace's abrupt breakup, leading her to move in with her best friend, Will. Their lives intertwine with those of their friends, Karen Walker, a wealthy and eccentric socialite, and Jack McFarland, an aspiring actor with boundless enthusiasm and questionable talent. Throughout the series, Will and Grace grapple with romantic entanglements, career setbacks, and personal growth, often providing comedic relief for one another. Karen's outrageous behavior and Jack's relentless pursuit of fame consistently provide a source of humor and chaos. As the series progresses, the characters face evolving social landscapes and personal challenges, ultimately reinforcing the enduring power of their friendship and chosen family. While romantic relationships come and go, the core dynamic between Will and Grace remains the heart of the show, demonstrating the strength of their bond through thick and thin.
response.keyword_sentence: Will & Grace is a lighthearted sitcom set in New York City, exploring themes of friendship, identity, and acceptance through the comedic trials and tribulations of a close-knit group of friends.
